m_szDocTitle: Zeppelin of the road | The Gisborne Herald
m_szDocSumamry: Zeppelin of the road From today a hydrogen-powered city car has started driving the streets in Britain. From today a hydrogen-powered city car has started driving the streets in Britain. The British-built Rasa runs on electricity generated by a hydrogen fuel cell. The two-seater will travel 482km on one 1.5kg fill-up of the lighter than air gas. Picture supplied ï»¿FINALLY, a sleek, affordable British-built hydrogen-powered electric city car has arrived. The electric car will reduce emissions, with just water coming from its exhaust. It even has gull wing doors. Called Rasa, the green vehicle
